title: Sledding in Maury County
text: LOCALSledding enthusiasts hit the slopes in Maury County on MondayDrew HulseySpecial to The Daily HeraldDella Settle, Alicia Settle, Dee Settle and Reese Settle have some family fun at Spring Hill Battlefield Park in Maury County in Spring Hill, Tenn. on Monday, Jan. 15, 2024.Drew HulseyHunter Walawender and Petey Oconnoolaa get ready to sled down the hill at Spring Hill Battlefield Park in Maury County, Tenn. on Monday, Jan. 15, 2024.Drew HulseySledders climb up the hill at Spring Hill Battlefield Park in Maury County on Monday, Jan. 15, 2024.Drew HulseyHunter Walawender And Petey Oconnoolaa head down the hill at Spring Hill Battlefield Park in Maury County, Tenn. on Jan. 15, 2024.Drew HulseyThe Settle family heads up the hill at Spring Hill Battlefield Park in Maury County on Jan. 15, 2024.Drew HulseyMickey Parsons pushes Taaron, Audrey and Josiah Parsons and dog Nugget down the hill at Spring Hill Battlefield Park in Maury County on Jan. 15, 2024Drew HulseyA snow plow clears Public Square in Columbia, Tennessee on Jan. 14, 2024.Drew HulseySnow covers West 7th Street in downtown Columbia, Tennessee on Jan. 14, 2024.Drew Hulsey

author: Salman Khan
title: Easter Bank Holiday to Face Wet Weather: Rain, Thunderstorms, and Snow Predicted
text:
As the Easter bank holiday approaches, residents across various regions are bracing for an expected continuation of wet weather, including rain , thunderstorms, and possibly snow in higher elevations. This forecast comes after a week of similar conditions, with significant precipitation affecting plans and activities for many looking forward to the holiday weekend.
Advertisment Storm Systems Set to Continue Forecasters are closely monitoring a low-pressure system set to bring heavy rain and thunderstorms to the Charleston area, with an alarming 90% chance of rain on Friday and 80% on Saturday. This could result in 2-3 inches of rainfall downtown, leading to minor flooding in susceptible areas. In Northern California, the situation appears similar, with rain showers and snow predicted over the Easter weekend. Snow levels could drop significantly, affecting travel and outdoor Easter celebrations. Meanwhile, San Diego County is expecting spring showers accompanied by gusty winds, and snow in mountain regions, potentially disrupting holiday plans.
Impact on Holiday Events and Activities Advertisment The adverse weather conditions pose a significant challenge for outdoor events and activities traditionally held over the Easter bank holiday. From community egg hunts to parades, the wet weather is likely to force cancellations or adjustments. Moreover, the forecasted conditions could exacerbate allergy symptoms for many, as noted by meteorologists in Northern California. Authorities and event organizers are urging the public to stay informed about the latest weather updates and plan accordingly.
Looking Ahead As the wet weather is expected to persist into early April, the impact on Easter bank holiday celebrations could be substantial. However, residents are advised to remain hopeful, as forecasters also predict that these conditions could bring much-needed relief to areas previously affected by drought. In the meantime, the community is coming together, adapting plans to ensure the holiday spirit remains undampened despite the forecast.
While the immediate outlook may seem gloomy, this Easter offers an opportunity for reflection on resilience and adaptability in the face of unforeseen challenges. As families and communities adjust their plans, the essence of the holiday—renewal and hope—remains a strong undercurrent, encouraging a collective spirit of perseverance.

author: AOL Staff
title: America should be the eagle, not the ostrich, of the clean energy transition
text: America should be the eagle, not the ostrich, of the clean energy transition Back in 2021, the U.S. passed the bipartisan Inflation Reduction Act, which promised to create hundreds of thousands of new jobs, spur innovation, and lead to investment opportunities for retirement savers. Now, over two years in, the IRA is creating positive change in the real economy. Some 272 new clean energy projects have been announced in small towns and big cities nationwide, [totaling $278 billion in new investments.](https://climatepower.us/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2023/07/Clean-Energy-Boom-Anniversary-Report-1.pdf) Unfortunately, as the 2024 political season heats up, the IRA is being politicized, despite the economic gains it is already providing. As politicians seek to garner attention through fearmongering, we as citizens must take back control of the agenda. The potential for America to be the global leader in the sustainable revolution is too big and strategic to miss. More importantly, it will unlock the potential for jobs, innovation, and investment that may equal or exceed those created by the industrial and technological revolutions. The challenge America should be focusing on is how we can transition away from today’s dominant energy and agricultural systems to ones that are equally productive but don’t lead to devastating side effects. Many companies are already making this shift, and it is exciting to see the energy transition accelerating in the U.S. and around the world, as many countries move quickly to seize the economic benefits. Yet every day, we hear from those commercially or politically tied to the polluting economic system defending the status quo or denying there is any problem. In doing so, they are delaying the inevitable transition, holding back job creation, ceding economic leadership to other economic blocs, and increasing the chances the environment will pass known tipping points and deteriorate even more rapidly, condemning future generations to conflict over resources. It is time for those halting economic progress to join the rest of us and focus on grasping the potential offered by the green transition. Job growth The emerging, more sustainable economy represents an economic boon. Between August 2022 and July 2023, over [170,000 new clean energy jobs](https://climatepower.us/wp-content/uploads/sites/23/2023/07/Clean-Energy-Boom-Anniversary-Report-1.pdf) were announced or advanced across 44 U.S. states. For example, electric battery and vehicle manufacturing, as well as solar and wind power generation, [offer quality jobs with attractive wages](https://www.brookings.edu/articles/advancing-inclusion-through-clean-energy-jobs/#:~:text=Workers%20in%20clean%20energy%20earn,per%20hour%20than%20other%20jobs.), around 45% of which require only a high school diploma. U.S. leadership Denial leads to delay and delay is fundamentally un-American. Our innovation and readiness to act are key strategic advantages. From the industrial revolution to the internet revolution, the U.S. has always been at the forefront of developing and deploying new technology. Taking on the challenge of establishing a less polluting economy will allow the U.S. to take a larger leadership role as these technologies develop and scale. Rather than relinquish this leadership to China, we must continue to invest and innovate. As one of the top two global polluters, the U.S. has the responsibility and ability to make a massive contribution. Investing in scaling clean energy technology is both the right thing to do and the way to build and safeguard our economy. Investment opportunities As an asset manager, we know that wealth creation happens through innovation and effective risk management. This transition will underpin a dramatic increase in new business creation, transform existing companies that are prepared to innovate and create a vast range of new goods and services on par with the enormously successful information technology sector. All transformation is investable–and there is widespread consensus around the scale of the economic opportunities that are emerging as companies address climate change. If those allocating pension funds and privately owned portfolios ignore this moment, they will miss out on enormous value creation and may be abdicating their responsibilities as fiduciaries. The U.S. has always met challenges with innovative solutions. After all, our nation is symbolized by the eagle, not the ostrich. Combatting pollution and stabilizing the climate is no exception. We must stop conceding the moment to worn-out biases, grievances, and politics. The transition to a more sustainable economy is already underway. It’s creating jobs, leveraging our country's innovative spirit, and asserting our global leadership. Smart investors around the world are already positioning their portfolios for the economy of the future. Ed Farrington is the president of Impax Asset Management. More must-read commentary published by Fortune: Here’s [how the U.S., Europe, and China are faring](https://fortune.com/2024/02/12/us-europe-china-post-pandemic-race-economic-growth/)in the post-pandemic race for economic growth Working fathers are the new target of microaggressions–and they are worried they could be getting [‘daddy tracked’](https://fortune.com/2024/02/06/working-fathers-microaggressions-daddy-tracked-careers/) [WEF president:](https://fortune.com/2024/01/15/wef-president-borge-brende-revitalize-trade-globalization-slowbalization/)‘It’s time to revitalize trade—and reverse the trend of Slowbalization’ The anti-DEI movement has gone [from fringe to mainstream](https://fortune.com/2024/01/04/anti-dei-movement-fringe-mainstream-corporate-america-diversity-equity-inclusion-meaning-joelle-emerson/). Here’s what that means for corporate America The opinions expressed in Fortune.com commentary pieces are solely the views of their authors and do not necessarily reflect the opinions and beliefs of Fortune. This story was originally featured on [Fortune.com](https://fortune.com/2024/02/15/america-should-be-the-eagle-not-the-ostrich-of-the-clean-energy-transition/)

author: Agenzia ANSA
title: Internado, Papa nomeia bispo auxiliar nos Estados Unidos
text:
Internado há uma semana em um hospital de Roma para tratar uma pneumonia bilateral e com uma condição clínica "complexa" devido a uma infecção "polimicrobiana", o papa Francisco fez uma nova nomeação de bispo auxiliar nos Estados Unidos nesta sexta-feira (21).
Segundo Boletim da Sala de Imprensa do Vaticano, o Pontífice nomeou o monsenhor Gregg M. Caggianelli, do clero da Diocese de Venice, Flórida, e vice-reitor do Seminário de São Vicente de Paulo em Boynton Beach, como bispo auxiliar do Ordinariado Militar para os Estados Unidos.
Desde o início do ano, Francisco tem feito várias nomeações na Igreja Católica nos Estados Unidos e, inclusive, escreveu uma carta a todos os bispos americanos para reiterar a linha de acolhida aos migrantes, em oposição às decisões do novo governo liderado por Donald Trump.
A nova nomeação indica que Jorge Bergoglio continua realizando atividades de trabalho no Hospital Policlínico Agostino Gemelli, em Roma, em meio à apreensão sobre o seu estado de saúde.
TODOS OS DIREITOS RESERVADOS © Copyright ANSA
